programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a bomb detonates at a restaurant in Queens, the case becomes personal for OA, who grew up eating there; OA goes under cover to prevent another incident.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After the son of a prominent blogger is kidnapped, the team must sweep through her two million followers to find the culprit; Kristen continues to adjust to life as a field agent with her new partner Stuart Scola.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a female presidential candidate, Valerie Caldwell, is targeted with a car bomb, OA and Maggie must find them before they strike again; the case leads them to wonder if she is being targeted for her political aspirations or something else.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a shooting at a nightclub, it appears that the FBI may have ignored previous threats from a local white supremacist group; Kristen wrestles with her commitment to the bureau and her responsibility to her community.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman hires Nick to track down her sister who has stolen a highly dangerous poisonous substance from a lab.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A serial killer stalks Sylvie.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An old flame of Nick's shows up. Although she's the one who cost him his job with the DEA, Nick is willing to let bygones be bygones, until he realizes that suspicious deaths seem to have followed her to Key Mariah.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Girard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siamang is no ordinary ape, its arms are longer than its legs and can swing 30 feet in a single bound! And the male wood duck is one of the most colorful creatures on Earth. Wonder why? The Tamandua uses a secret weapon to slurp up 10000 insects/day!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Creatures from the continent of South America; a jaguar's jaws' ability to crush bone; the growth of a Galapagos tortoise.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: In this episode there are warning signs, potential disasters, and evidence of previous catastrophes. Join Philippe Cousteau as we explore the possibilities of extinction Earth, here on Xploration Awesome Planet!

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: In this episode, prehistoric reptiles lurk below and giant beasts roam the open plains. Join Phillipe ousteu as we explore diverse ecosystems on Xploration Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: In this episode, tornadoes twist in open plaines, and hurricanes wreak havoc on coastal communities. Join Phillipe Cousteu as we explore extreme weather on Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we will be looking at a fascinating subject that most of us take for granted. To do so, I'll be hiking through forests, kayaking on lakes, and even venturing through scientific laboratories, all to explore the Amazing World of Plants.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Bottle Girl
programme.desc: Diamond's dream of going to college is threatened by financial hardship. A desperate job at a glamorous Atlanta lounge exposes her to a world of temptation and danger.

programme.title: The Queens Court
programme.desc: An all-female underground organization rules every criminal activity in the city, and nothing can be done without their approval. Those who fail to comply are dealt with, by any means necessary.

Clint Meyers is a top-selling real estate agent and investor who projects sensitivity, but harbors a dark side. Their worlds collide when a chance encounter on a traumatic flight leads to a deadly obsession.

programme.title: The Break of Dawn
programme.desc: College student Dawn Monea tried to find love through online dating, but soon finds out the man she is dating is not who he says he is.

programme.title: Stick Up

programme.title: Bruised 2
programme.desc: Two years after the death of her husband, Kayla Brown has rebuilt her life following the launch of her successful memoir. she is then visited by a stalker, who is hell-bent on making her pay for what she has done in order to escape her husband.

programme.title: Quiet as Kept
programme.desc: Jay is unlawfully detained. His ex-girlfriend returns, and his business partners work to clear his name. Meanwhile, a crooked cop is under suspicion for murder, and connections are made between him and Jay. Torn between duty and loyalty, Detective Johnson is caught in the middle. As the prosecution struggles, Jay and his business partners work to exist the dangerous world cleanly.

programme.title: Three of a Kind

programme.title: Black Game Night
programme.desc: A group of friends prepare to attend the Blacks' annual game night, but make a discovery when they arrive to find the hosts have been brutally murdered. In their pursuit to uncover the murderer, secrets unravel and betrayals are discovered.

programme.title: Runway of Shadows

programme.title: My Killer Ex Girlfriend
programme.desc: After leaving his possessive ex, a man and his new girlfriend become targets of stalking that escalates into mind games, threats, and danger.

programme.title: Redemption

programme.desc: Lavell Crawford, with a new look and new outlook on life, hosts a new standup special.

programme.title: Maria Bamford: Weakness Is the Brand
programme.desc: Comedian Maria Bamford is back and subjectively better than ever! Weakness is her brand, so get ready to feel much better about yourself

programme.title: Aaron Karo: The Rest Is History
programme.desc: In his first one-hour stand-up special, funnyman Aaron Karo raises the comedy bar as he uncorks his witty observations on bridesmaids' speeches, tanked-up friends who always start fights and the perils of being a 30-year-old bachelor.

programme.title: Anthony Locascio: Confirmation
programme.desc: At 12 years old, every good Catholic boy has his Confirmation. Evidently, Anthony Locascio was not a "good" Catholic boy, because he never had one.

programme.title: Zarna Garg: One in a Billion
programme.desc: Zarna, an Indian-Immigrant mom, has plenty to joke about.

programme.title: Lachlan Patterson: Live From Venice Beach
programme.desc: Known for his scalpel-sharp wit, Lachlan Patterson shares his musings on make-up, mugshots, and more live from his home turf of Venice Beach.

programme.title: Kellen Erskine: Zoomed Out
programme.desc: In this comedy special, Kellen Erskine ponders everyday oddities, from robot vacuums to the baton-waving workers who direct planes at the airport.

programme.title: Kellen Erskine: Composed
programme.desc: Featured on NBC's “America's Got Talent,” this stand-up comic has written jokes that appear in a variety of publications, including “Reader's Digest.”

programme.title: Josh Blue: Delete
programme.desc: With an undeniably unique world view, Blue explores preconceived notions of disability and how the community feels about being called “inspirational.”

programme.title: Josh Blue: Sticky Change
programme.desc: Quipster Josh Blue hits the stage where he turns his cerebral palsy and cross-cultural marriage into comedy gold.

programme.title: Josh Blue: The Disabled List
programme.desc: The winner of Last Comic Standing discusses the obvious questions people ask him, misunderstandings about being a disabled person, and more.

programme.title: Kevin Bozeman: Clean and Unfiltered
programme.desc: In 1999, this funnyman and musical satirist found himself in the real world, with no real job skills and a burning desire to work only one hour a day.

programme.title: Michael McDonald: Model. Citizen.
programme.desc: Comedian Michael McDonald returns home to Orange County for his debut stand-up comedy special: Model. Citizen.

programme.title: Taylor Mason: Hysterical Perspective
programme.desc: Taylor Mason performs.

programme.title: Wendy Liebman: It’s Wendy
programme.desc: Wendy Liebman delivers 45 minutes of pure gold, discussing things like pen pals, the magic of tidying up your space, and her goofy dogs.

programme.title: Whitney Cummings: Money Shot
programme.desc: Comedy Central roast veteran Whitney Cummings gets the stage to herself in this debut special, which finds the young comedian riffing on a wide range of topics, chiefly the differences between men and women and how both behave in relationships.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: I Could Eat - Part 1
programme.desc: Lavell Crawford is back and here to contemplate how "My 600 Pound Life" could go for 15 seasons and he was still underweight, the kind of racist you have to be to not take a free holiday, and explosive consequences in a Taco Bell bathroom.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford I Could Eat Part 2
programme.desc: Meat's on the menu with Lavell Crawford keeping Burger King humble to their have it your way slogan, godless vegetarians, and why the best chicken is from a house of God.

programme.title: Lavell Crawford: The Comedy Vaccine (Extended Edition)
programme.desc: The Saul Goodman heavy takes his fifth stand-up special to Tempe, Arizona and he’s not holding back about anything—especially COVID-19.

programme.title: Louie Anderson: Big Underwear
programme.desc: The iconic comic plays on the challenges of getting healthy, life on the road, dealing with technology and how we all eventually become our parents.

programme.title: Louie Anderson: Big Baby Boomer
programme.desc: Veteran funny man Louie Anderson returns to the stage in this hilarious one hour stand up comedy special. Louie takes an unconventional and jovial look at his bad habits, pesky family members, and aging body.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don welcomes us to his garden at Longmeadow and offers some tips on keeping our gardens at their best throughout the season. Carol Klein meets wildlife enthusiast Steve Head, to discover more about the wildlife that depend on our garden ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don will be cutting back his delphiniums and adding a touch of the exotic to his Jewel Garden. Carol Klein is in Kent meeting lavender expert and breeder, Dr Simon Charlesworth, whose stunning walled garden is packed with many varieties of this beautifully scented plant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn well under way, some plants in the garden need to be brought in under cover. Monty Don makes a start by insulating his greenhouse to provide a winter home for all sorts of tender plants and gives his tips and techniques for ensuring their survival until next year. Carol Klein visits the garden of a tropical plant enthusiast to find out how he protects some of his exotic specimens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles some seasonal gardening jobs at Longmeadow and guest presenter Matthew Wilson has some ideas to brighten up a dark, north-facing wall.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is preparing for spring colour as well as harvesting pumpkins and squashes. Carol Klein visits comedian Joe Lycett at home, and together, they plant up a container packed with layers of colourful bulbs. Toby Buckland visits Sue Kent's garden near Swansea to help out with autumnal maintenance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the plants in the jewel garden reach the peak of their late summer glory, Monty starts planning for the spring when he plants ferns and gives advice on the care and maintenance of wildlife ponds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don and Nigel make the most of the season and prepare for the winter ahead. Meanwhile Carol Klein is in Surrey looking at wild and cultivated heathers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is in Hampshire with the great horticulturist, Roy Lancaster, appreciating the virtues of the often overlooked St John's wort. Joe Swift is out and about too and visits a very unusual allotment in Tottenham, North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: For many gardeners, the beginning of September is the start of a new season. Monty Don embraces this shift as he harvests an abundance of delicious produce, at the same time as looking ahead to the spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don adds some foxtail lilies to his dry garden, Carol Klein visits salvia expert William Dyson in Kent, and we meet a remarkable woman from a family of gardeners on the eve of her 100th birthday.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don cuts back his wildflower meadow and, with an eye on some early season colour next year, makes a start on planting up his spring containers. Joe Swift learns the importance of allotment bee keeping when he visits a plot in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As well as catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow, Monty Don meets world-renowned garden designer, Piet Oudolf, at his latest creation in Somerset. He gets to grips with Oudolf's iconic naturalistic planting and explains how we can adapt this style to our very own gardens. Meanwhile, Carol Klein goes tree climbing in Bristol to find out how important these precious havens are for urban wildlife.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the arrival of October, it is time to start thinking about getting some onions and garlic in the ground, and Monty Don shares his secrets on how to get a successful crop. Elsewhere, Carol Klein takes first-time gardeners Dan and Dominique for a day out in Devon. They are on the hunt for some seasonal inspiration for their new garden and what better place to look than RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: We find out how Rachel de Thame got on over the past year as she attempted to grow her own cut flowers, and if you're still in a quandary about what to grow in your winter pots this year, Monty Don may well have the answer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn gathers momentum, it's time to start putting the garden to bed for winter. Monty Don has some timely advice on what to do. Carol Klein meets a nurseryman in Herefordshire and together they indulge in the beauty of the Japanese maple.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn on the horizon, the seasonal planting of bulbs for spring-flowering begins at Longmeadow. Frances Tophill meets a gardener whose allotment is filled with both traditional and exotic vegetables and Toby Buckland visits The Newt in Somerset to find out about its chequered garden history and to explore its emergence as one of the UK's most exciting gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty refreshes a container of overgrown herbs, plants alpines and revisits the shrub and perennial cuttings he took a few weeks ago. Arit Anderson meets a designer who is placing sustainability and the environment at the heart of her gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As autumn unfolds in the garden, Monty Don and Nigel make the most of the season and prepare for the winter ahead. Meanwhile Carol Klein is in Surrey looking at wild and cultivated heathers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost is at home sharing his love of ornamental grasses, tackling the problem of building a patio on a slope and giving some inspiration on what to plant at the base of a wall. In Margate, the team visit a man who has come up with a unique way of using a shed roof to grow vegetables, and they travel to Swansea to meet inspirational gardener Sue Kent, who shows how she has designed her garden to enable her to garden successfully despite her upper limb difference.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than what’s in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. For this Seattle-based SST Ravens, this skeet and trap team finds that the challenging weather they train in comes in handy when competing. Also: Competition shooting tips form pro shooter Theo Ribbs.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Deer season — the sights, the sounds and the smells stick with you. It’s about remembering those who came before us and setting the right example for those who look up to us. It’s about protecting the tradition, so they always have something to look forward to. When communities come together, we see the real reason for this special time of year.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: READY TO ROLL!!…almostWe have our bus. We have our boat. And we have Mr. J. Rockfish on board to steer the ship. But before we can hit the road, we’ve got some work to do.The bus…it needs a new motor and maybe some other stuff (TBD) that’s been hiding under 40 years of crust and crud…The boat, it needs some fiberglass work. A casting platform and floor would be cool…maybe a paint job.And Jay, well his gear is pretty shot, and his normally ripped physique has been obscured under some COVID poundage he acquired over the past year or so…And maybe a pedicure and haircut are in order before stepping in front of the camera…First, the bus. A little interior decorating perhaps. The 14 seats built for preschoolers don’t quite accommodate over-sized fishing dudes. And, come to find out, there are no rod racks. No bar. No stereo. No beds. No fly-tying stations. And no beer fridge. How did those kids survive?Time to gut this thing…Check it out! #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Jay made it to Austin, Texas, the hill country hub for public water, hungry fish, and innovative anglers.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Fed by the Mekong River, Tonlé Sap Lake in Cambodia is not only home to hundreds of thousands of people living in the floating villages, it is also the source of 75% of Cambodia’s fish (equal to 60% of the country’s protein intake). Because of a combination of threats, from pollution to climate change, the densely populated area’s fish populations are dwindling – but locals are educating themselves on ways to make change. In this beautifully photographed award-winning film, we get a rare glimpse into life on the lake while learning how a dedicated conservation group is combatting plastic pollution.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: At age seven, Cash “The Conservation Kid” Daniels began leading cleanups along the Tennessee River in his hometown, Chattanooga. Six years later, Cash continues to make a significant impact on the river’s health by strategically collecting fishing waste and inspiring his peers across the world to protect the environment and all the wildlife he holds dear.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Capt Brandon visits Quails Landing Plantation in South Georgia and his buddy Steven Redrick to do all things outdoors.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: In this episode Mark is excited to return to famous Sam Rayburn to fish with one of the legends of bass fishing, Tommy Martin; they'll discuss and capture some information on Tommy's career on this trip for the episode. Also will note that Mark fished a Bassmaster Open on the lake back in the early 2000's. Another interesting tidbit is that Mark was actually on Sam Rayburn fishing when the space shuttle blew up; he actually heard the explosion and felt the rumble.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Army veteran Carlos Powell tells of family sacrifice and fighting his post service “demons.”

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Dirty 30 is a groundbreaking docu-series filmed, edited, and directed by Eric Guarino. In this first episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the Bassmaster Elite Series on the iconic St. Johns River. As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road.From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.Folks at home,Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you, the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you. I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!! — Ike

programme.desc: In this episode, Chef Jay Ducote brings along a very special fishing buddy, his dad, for our first-ever Catch & Cook freshwater adventure! programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than what’s in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: It’s opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexico’s most popular fish?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: There’s nothing like a change in weather conditions to wreck a perfectly good fishing plan, and that’s exactly what Capt. Justin Leake and his cousin encounter when December turns unseasonably warm. It’s a grey morning with thick fog so Justin and Capt. Brent Berry won’t be heading offshore right away as planned. Instead, Justin turns to his Humminbird CoastMaster charts to pinpoint a near shore artificial reef just five minutes from the St. Andrews Pass, where the anglers will do a little fishing until the fog burns off. Capt. Leake opts to send a jig to the bottom and he’s not very picky about the one that gets tied on. “When fishing reefs, the specific jig doesn’t matter because it’s all about the presentation,” he says. “When you’re sitting on top of a wreck, break out the ‘junk jigs’ – they get bit just fine.” And that proves to be the case as Justin and Brent enjoy non-stop battles against amberjack, red snapper and bonita. And with a bite this good, there’s no reason to go anywhere else! Also, we take a look at the United States Coast Guard Auxiliary’s new paddle craft safety initiative.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 4 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller explores Jupiter’s Inner Coastal Waterway, blending fishing, paddleboarding, and community engagement. With the help of Matthew from Jupiter Live Bait, Ryan showcases bait preparation techniques before catching snook in the vibrant ICW. He highlights Jupiter's community spirit by joining a local clean-up initiative with Jeremy from Blue Line Paddleboards. The episode features paddleboarding adventures with Ryan’s family, connecting with nature and marine life, and ends with a conservation message about preserving Jupiter’s pristine environment.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryan’s passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate – outside – in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: It’s been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the world’s best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The Pacific Northwest does not have the easiest conditions to train in for this shooting sports team. For this Seattle-based SST Ravens, this skeet and trap team finds that the challenging weather they train in comes in handy when competing. Also: Competition shooting tips form pro shooter Theo Ribbs.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Deer season — the sights, the sounds and the smells stick with you. It’s about remembering those who came before us and setting the right example for those who look up to us. It’s about protecting the tradition, so they always have something to look forward to. When communities come together, we see the real reason for this special time of year.

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: READY TO ROLL!!…almostWe have our bus. We have our boat. And we have Mr. J. Rockfish on board to steer the ship. But before we can hit the road, we’ve got some work to do.The bus…it needs a new motor and maybe some other stuff (TBD) that’s been hiding under 40 years of crust and crud…The boat, it needs some fiberglass work. A casting platform and floor would be cool…maybe a paint job.And Jay, well his gear is pretty shot, and his normally ripped physique has been obscured under some COVID poundage he acquired over the past year or so…And maybe a pedicure and haircut are in order before stepping in front of the camera…First, the bus. A little interior decorating perhaps. The 14 seats built for preschoolers don’t quite accommodate over-sized fishing dudes. And, come to find out, there are no rod racks. No bar. No stereo. No beds. No fly-tying stations. And no beer fridge. How did those kids survive?Time to gut this thing…Check it out! #fishingwithjay

programme.title: Fishing With Jay
programme.desc: Jay made it to Austin, Texas, the hill country hub for public water, hungry fish, and innovative anglers.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Fed by the Mekong River, Tonlé Sap Lake in Cambodia is not only home to hundreds of thousands of people living in the floating villages, it is also the source of 75% of Cambodia’s fish (equal to 60% of the country’s protein intake). Because of a combination of threats, from pollution to climate change, the densely populated area’s fish populations are dwindling – but locals are educating themselves on ways to make change. In this beautifully photographed award-winning film, we get a rare glimpse into life on the lake while learning how a dedicated conservation group is combatting plastic pollution.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: At age seven, Cash “The Conservation Kid” Daniels began leading cleanups along the Tennessee River in his hometown, Chattanooga. Six years later, Cash continues to make a significant impact on the river’s health by strategically collecting fishing waste and inspiring his peers across the world to protect the environment and all the wildlife he holds dear.

programme.title: Local Lines
programme.desc: Capt Brandon visits Quails Landing Plantation in South Georgia and his buddy Steven Redrick to do all things outdoors.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: In this episode Mark is excited to return to famous Sam Rayburn to fish with one of the legends of bass fishing, Tommy Martin; they'll discuss and capture some information on Tommy's career on this trip for the episode. Also will note that Mark fished a Bassmaster Open on the lake back in the early 2000's. Another interesting tidbit is that Mark was actually on Sam Rayburn fishing when the space shuttle blew up; he actually heard the explosion and felt the rumble.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: U.S. Army veteran Carlos Powell tells of family sacrifice and fighting his post service “demons.”

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Southards are heads to Table Rock for the annual family vacation. Receding water poses a challenge but there’s no lack of fish or laughs at the lake!

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Qualifier 3 has the BaitFuel Fishing Tour Teams Cornwall, Ontario for a back to back on Lake St. Francis.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara head to Tamarack Island and explain why when ice fishing big water being able to breakdown structure is critical to success.

programme.title: Dirty 30
programme.desc: Dirty 30 is a groundbreaking docu-series filmed, edited, and directed by Eric Guarino. In this first episode, we follow Mike Iaconelli to the Bassmaster Elite Series on the iconic St. Johns River. As the camera rolls, we dive deep into the fishing world, shedding light on the industry and exploring the untold stories from Ike’s incredible 30-year career on the road.From behind-the-scenes moments to raw, unfiltered insights, this episode peels back the curtain on what it really takes to thrive in professional fishing. Get ready for some dirt, real talk, BIG FISH, and an up-close look at one of the sport’s most legendary figures.Folks at home,Celebrating 30 years in professional bass fishing is an incredible journey, and it wouldn’t be possible without you, the fans. Bass fishing professionally is really all about the fans, and I just want to say how much I appreciate every single one of you. I hope you enjoy the show!NEVER GIVE UP!!! — Ike

programme.desc: Homicide detective Kenny Williams (Melvyn Douglas) is so attached to his police work that his longtime fiancée, Maxine Carroll (Joan Blondell), wonders if he would rather solve a case than get married. When Maxine convinces the police captain (Clarence Kolb) to threaten Kenny with suspension, Kenny shows his dedication by accepting a case requiring him to dress as a woman. With a killer on the loose, Kenny must decide between his career obligations and his fiancée's wishes.
